duties_responsibilities.duty: Drive talent planning, development, and engagement while maximizing associate productivity through the optimization of talent.
Strategize, plan, and prioritize to provide optimal support to the portfolio of stores.
Lead ownership and implementation of HR initiatives, acting as a subject matter expert in company policies, programs, and operational processes.
Provide objective, quality guidance and oversight on employee relations issues.
Identify opportunities and collaborate with business partners to drive continuous improvement.
Act as a proactive, solution-oriented business partner at all levels, providing guidance and quality decision-making that adheres to core principles.
Partner to develop and drive regional engagement strategy and promote a culture of safe and secure stores.
Uses data to set priorities, translate goals into action plans, and consistently pushes self and others for results.
Acquire and retain the right talent, train, coach, and provide feedback to develop team and position them for growth.

Acts with customers in mind, understands and teaches how operational execution directly affects the customer experience, and is dedicated to meeting the expectations and requirements of internal and external customers.
Makes the company vision sharable by everyone, inspires and motivates entire units, is forward-looking, and talks beyond today.
Sees ahead clearly, can anticipate future consequences and trends, has broad knowledge and perspective, and can create effective and advanced strategies and plans.
Can effectively cope with and lead through change, decide and act without having the total picture when necessary, and can comfortably handle risk and uncertainty.
Ensures compliance with all policies, procedures, and laws.

education_certification.credential: Bachelors/Associates Degree preferred or High School graduate/Equivalent, HR certification preferred
